title: Hayward Universal H-Series Digital (HFDN) — Guided Troubleshooting

enter_serial.text: Enter the heater serial number (for your final PDF/report).

field_voltage_select.text: What is the heater wired for at the field wiring panel?

measure_line_120.text: Measure incoming line voltage at the heater (120 V config). Expect 110–126 VAC.

measure_line_240.text: Measure incoming line voltage at the heater (240 V config). Expect 220–252 VAC.

powerup_2.text: Does the Selector Plug match the incoming voltage?

powerup_3.text: Are all Fuse Board connections secure and correctly seated?

powerup_4.text: Measure transformer secondary at P4 pins 1 & 2. Expect 22–28 VAC.

powerup_5.text: Measure primary feed at P4 pins 4 & 6. Expect 110–125 VAC.

powerup_6.text: Verify 22–28 VAC between R & C terminals on the Fuse Board.

powerup_7.text: Verify 22–28 VAC between R & C on the ICB.

powerup_8.text: Are all ICB plugs fully seated and keyed correctly?

powerup_9.text: Measure 22–28 VAC between COM & AC on the ICB.

powerup_10.text: Check F1 fuse (3 A) on ICB for continuity. Good?

powerup_11.text: Is the display dry and do keypad buttons read correctly?

fc12_1.text: Is the correct voltage selector plug installed?

fc12_2.text: Is the transformer wiring free of damage, pinches, or abrasion?

fc12_3.text: Measure transformer primary resistance. Expect 1.9–2.9 Ω.

fc3f1_1.text: Inspect low-voltage wiring for damage or pinches. OK?

fc3f1_2.text: Measure resistance across the gas valve coil. Expect > 0.5 Ω.

fc3f1_3.text: Inspect ICB wiring and insulation for shorts. OK?

fc4_1.text: Inspect igniter and blower wiring insulation for chafing/shorts. OK?

fc4_3.text: Measure blower motor resistance. Pre-2010: 8–9 Ω. Post-2010: 4–5 Ω.

bd_1.text: Remove FC4 fuse and check continuity. Good?

bd_2.text: Measure 110–125 VAC between P6-3 and P6-5 on Fuse Board.

bd_3.text: Measure 110–125 VAC at E10 (pins 1 & 3) of the ICB harness.

eece_ee.text: EE Code indicates a defective ICB (EEPROM error). Replace the ICB.

eece_ce.text: CE Code indicates a comms error between display and ICB. 1) Power-cycle line voltage. 2) Inspect display ribbon cable and connector fit. If the code persists, replace the Display Interface Assembly / Keypad; if still present, replace the ICB.

iosb_1.text: IO: Inspect igniter wiring/plug — secure and undamaged?

sfpfs_1.text: Check temperature sensor (thermistor) plug at ICB. Fully seated?

sfpfs_2.text: Measure temperature sensor resistance (black to each red). Expect ≈ 10k Ω @ 77°F and both reds should match.

hf_1.text: Reset the heater (cycle line power OFF/ON). Did HF clear?

hf_2.text: With gas valve OFF, is flame still sensed (false flame)?

hf_3.text: During the fault, measure control output to gas valve. Expect ~24 VAC when flame is actually present. If 24 VAC is present but valve closed and manifold pressure correct: valve is defective. If 24 VAC not present and manifold pressure is correct: replace ICB.

lo_1.text: Verify pump operation and adequate water flow. Flow above minimum?

lo_2.text: Inspect Water Pressure Switch wiring and spade connections. OK?

lo_3.text: With pump running, does the Water Pressure Switch show continuity (closed)?

lo_4.text: Inspect Temperature Limit Switch wiring and terminals. OK?

lo_5.text: Do the Temperature Limit Switches have continuity (closed)?

if_1.text: Are all external and internal gas shutoff valves fully OPEN?

if_2.text: Inspect flame sensor and gas valve wiring/terminals. OK?

if_3.text: Measure manifold gas pressure during trial for ignition. Propane 6.8–7.0 inWC; Natural Gas 1.8–2.0 inWC.

if_4.text: During the 4-second trial for ignition, measure 22–28 VAC at the Gas Valve.

ac_ao_1.text: Inspect blower vacuum tubing, hose barbs, wiring and connections. OK?

ac_ao_2.text: Is the voltage selector plug installed for the correct supply voltage?

ac_ao_3.text: Measure blower resistance. Pre-2010: 8–9 Ω. Post-2010: 4–5 Ω.

ac_ao_4.text: During pre-purge/call for heat, measure 110–125 VAC at blower relay output.

flow_complete.text: ✅ Troubleshooting complete. If the issue persists, contact Hayward Tech Support.

check_power_source.text: Correct incoming power/breaker/wiring to the heater, then retest.

install_correct_selector_plug.text: Install the correct voltage selector plug for the supply (120/240 VAC), then retest.

correct_wiring.text: Correct any loose/incorrect Fuse Board wiring and reseat connectors, then retest.

replace_transformer.text: Transformer out of spec. Replace transformer.

replace_fuse_board.text: Fuse Board not supplying 24 VAC. Replace Fuse Board.

replace_wire_harness.text: Harness between boards open/shorted. Replace Wire Harness.

correct_icb_wiring.text: Reseat/realign ICB plugs and correct any keying issues; inspect for bent pins.

replace_icb.text: ICB defective/out of spec. Replace ICB.

replace_icb_fuse.text: Replace the F1 3-amp fuse on the ICB, then retest.

repair_wiring.text: Repair/replace damaged wiring and ensure proper routing and strain relief.

replace_gas_valve.text: Gas valve coil out of spec/valve defective. Replace gas valve.

replace_igniter.text: Igniter out of spec or open. Replace igniter.

replace_blower.text: Blower motor out of spec. Replace blower.

secure_sensor.text: Reseat/secure temperature sensor connector at ICB, then retest.

replace_sensor.text: Temperature sensor out of spec. Replace sensor.

turn_on_pump.text: Start circulation pump / restore proper water flow before proceeding.

replace_pressure_switch.text: Water Pressure Switch open during flow. Replace switch.

replace_limit_switch.text: Temperature Limit Switch open. Replace limit switch(es).

open_gas_valves.text: Open all gas shutoff valves and verify supply to the heater.

adjust_gas_pressure.text: Adjust inlet/manifold gas pressure to manufacturer spec, then retest.

repair_tubing.text: Repair/replace blower vacuum tubing and ensure hose barbs are sealed.

replace_display_board.text: Replace the Display Interface/Keypad board if ribbon and connections are OK.

replace_flame_sensor.text: Install the correct flame sensor (5" on models after 4/14/2009).
